clean_content:
Definition / general

* Lymphoepithelial cysts are uncommon benign oral cavity cysts

Essential features

* Oral lymphoepithelial cysts are most common in the lateral tongue and floor of mouth* Histologic features include a squamous epithelial lined cyst filled with keratin debris and stromal lymphoid tissue* Treatment is conservative surgical excision with no recurrence

Terminology

* Oral lymphoepithelial cyst* Intraoral lymphoepithelial cyst* Benign lymphoepithelial cyst

ICD coding

* ICD-10:
  + [K09.8](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/K00-K95/K00-K14/K09-/K09.8) - other cysts of oral region, not elsewhere classified+ [K09.9](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/K00-K95/K00-K14/K09-/K09.9) - cyst of oral region, unspecified

Epidemiology

* < 1% of all lesions in oral cavity* Occurs in adults
    + Most common in fifth to sixth decade+ F > M ([Head Neck Pathol 2021 Jun 29 [Epub ahead of print]](34185247))

Sites

* Oral cavity ([Head Neck Pathol 2021 Jun 29 [Epub ahead of print]](34185247), [J Oral Pathol Med 2020;49:219](31782199))
  + Most common site: ventral and posterolateral tongue+ Second most common site: floor of mouth+ Other sites in the oral cavity: buccal mucosa, palate, tonsillar pillar, lip

Etiology

* Unknown:
  + Leading theory: pseudocysts develop from obstruction of tonsil crypt of oral tonsil tissue ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1970;29:295](5263531))+ Another theory postulates traumatic implantation of epithelium into deeper tissues, forming cyst ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1963;16:1214](14079991))+ A third theory postulates lymphoid tissue with ectopic foci of entrapped glandular epithelium ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1966;21:120](5215902))* Oral lymphoepithelial cyst is not associated with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), unlike a subset of lymphoepithelial cysts of the major salivary glands

Clinical features

* Small, white-yellow submucosal nodule* < 1 cm* Often painless and asymptomatic* References: [Head Neck Pathol 2021 Jun 29 [Epub ahead of print]](34185247), [J Oral Pathol Med 2020;49:219](31782199)

Diagnosis

* Combination of clinical and histologic findings

Prognostic factors

* Good prognosis* No recurrence after excision

Case reports

* 21 year old man with lymphoepithelial cyst in the palatine tonsil ([Int J Clin Exp Pathol 2015;8:4264](26097623))* 42 year old woman with multiple lymphoepithelial cysts ([Indian J Pathol Microbiol 2013;56:473](24441255))* 55 and 57 year old women with oral lymphoepithelial cysts ([Bull Tokyo Dent Coll 2012;53:17](22452887))

Treatment

* Conservative surgical excision

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialcinnih01.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4467010/figure/fig01/)

Lymphoepithelial cyst in tonsil

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialclinnih02.jpg)](https://www.ijpmonline.org/article.asp?issn=0377-4929;year=2013;volume=56;issue=4;spage=473;epage=474;aulast=Chaves#ft4)

Lymphoepithelial cyst, floor of mouth

Gross description

* Cystic structure, well demarcated, filled with yellowish keratin-like material

Gross images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialgrossnih01.jpg)](https://www.ijpmonline.org/article.asp?issn=0377-4929;year=2013;volume=56;issue=4;spage=473;epage=474;aulast=Chaves#ft4)

Lymphoepithelial cyst, floor of mouth

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Well circumscribed cyst lined by parakeratinized stratified squamous epithelium with lymphoid stroma
  + May have connection to overlying epithelium but not always identified+ Other cyst linings: nonkeratinized squamous epithelium, respiratory metaplasia or ciliated pseudostratified epithelium (or any combination)+ Cyst contents: predominantly keratin debris, amorphous eosinophilic material and inflammatory cells+ Lymphoid stroma may or may not have germinal centers+ Rarely subgemmal neurogenous plaques have been reported near the cyst ([Head Neck Pathol 2021 Jun 29 [Epub ahead of print]](34185247), [J Oral Pathol Med 2020;49:219](31782199))

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by John Kalmar, D.M.D., Ph.D.  

[![Floor of mouth cyst](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialKalmar1.JPG)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialKalmar1.JPG)

Floor of mouth cyst

[![Squamous epithelial lining](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialKalmar2.JPG)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialKalmar2.JPG)

Squamous epithelial lining

[![Lateral tongue cyst](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialKalmar3.JPG)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialKalmar3.JPG)

Lateral tongue cyst

[![Germinal center in stroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialKalmar4.JPG)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillalymphoepithelialKalmar4.JPG)

Germinal center in stroma

Positive stains

* Cyst lining: [p40](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsdeltaNp63.html)+* Lymphoid stroma: [CD20](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd20.html)+ cells predominant, rare [CD3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd3.html)+ ([J Oral Pathol Med 2020;49:219](31782199))

Sample pathology report

* Floor of mouth, biopsy:
  + Oral lymphoepithelial cyst

Differential diagnosis

* [Epidermal inclusion cyst (epidermoid cyst)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/skintumornonmelanocytickeratinouscystepidermal.html):
  + Squamous lined cyst without lymphoid stroma* **Sebaceous cyst**:
    + Squamous lined cyst with adnexal structures, lacking lymphoid stroma* [Fordyce granules](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityfordyce.html):
      + Clusters of sebaceous glands* [Sialolith](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/salivaryglandssialolithiasis.html):
        + Calcified material with surrounding ductal epithelium (with squamous metaplasia)* [Mucocele](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitymucocele.html):
          + Pseudocyst filled with mucin, lined by histiocytes and lymphocytes* [Foreign body reaction](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/skinnontumorforeignbodyreaction.html):
            + Numerous multinucleated giant cells with poorly formed granulomas with foreign material* [Squamous cell carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityscc.html):
              + Invasive proliferation of squamous nests
